captions.text:
- It was at that moment
that I realized that,
okay, wow, I am different.

- A small comment in such
a short period of time
can stick with you.

- Yeah, I was definitely
picked on as a kid.
- Oh yeah.
Look at me, of course I got picked on!

- I think you always dream
about going back to a situation,
especially when it's recent,

and being able to say what
you really wanted to say

to the people that hurt
you or tormented you.

- When I was eight I
was on the playground,

and one of my friends
told me I had elf ears.
Which isn't really even that mean,
but it like stuck with me.
My response now would be,
ever heard of Legolas?
- I had to wear leg braces because I was
pigeon-toed and I had bow legs.
And there was a new student in my class,
and the first thing out of her mouth

that she said when she was
me was that I walk funny.
That I walk like a duck.
If by "duck" you meant "Mighty Duck",
then you are correct.
- In fifth grade I was told that
I have fat, wrinkly hands.
And, I'm not gonna lie,
it's a little bit true.
Well you know what, fifth grade bullies?
I went to a palm reader in high school,

and she told me that all
the wrinkles on my fat hands
mean that I have wise hands.
Not fat wrinkly hands, wise hands.

- I was wearing this
like really red shirt,
and my sister said, you shouldn't wear red
because it brings out your pimples.

- People make fun of me
for my hair all the time.
Just 'cause it grows up naturally.

Put the hate away, love yourself,
and leave everybody alone.
- I've always kind of had a baby face.

So it was my first day of
middle school in a new school.
We're talking about what
fake football jersey name you would have.

This kid said, hey, on
the back of your jersey
it should say "Little Bitch".
I came home in tears and
said I wanted to go back to my old school.

- A group of kids would
call me "chinky eyes".
Somehow my eyes equated to being ugly,
and I didn't quite understand that it was
just an ethnic difference.
- I was overweight and I was depressed.
There's a certain member of my family
that everybody is afraid of.
She just came after me.

Kept telling me I was fat,
kept telling me to lose weight,
kept telling me I was fat.

- I think the best I could
do is be above all of it,

and the worst you can do
is believe what they say.

I guess I would just say,
"I don't believe you".
- That stuck with me, and has made me
not want to feel weak.
I ain't no bitch.
'Cause I'm not.
- I do what I want.
- They might fear you, but I don't.

- To anyone out there who's
being picked on or bullied,
you can't change the way others think,

but you can control how
you think about yourself.
- When you're younger you just want to
look like everybody else, and when you
get older we all want to look different.

- There are other people out
there who are just like you,
who are going through the same things.
- And sometimes you can take a weakness
and turn it into a strength.

Just a little bit of wisdom
I got from these guys.
- Boom, mike drop, what's up.
You're welcome, Internet.
That felt great.
That did, that really did.

title: Men Respond To Their Childhood Bullies

comments.text:
Hey, the penguin has issues with talking, and he's apparently the king of 
gotham.﻿

comments.text: Who in their right minds, would pick on Eugene? He's gorgeous <3.﻿

comments.text:
In my school I would be called ching chong from my bullies and they did it 
for others entertainment. So I switched it around calling myself ching 
chong and laugh myself. But I think the worst K is how you look. I'm 11 
years old and I'm very skinny and my ribcage is kinda bent inwards and in 
the changing room after gymnastic everyone would tell me to get muscles and 
eat more and on the outside I'm laughing but in the inside I'm broken. 
Please if someone sees this and feels the way I fell tell me﻿

Weakness into strength. Like what? I'm not smart, I am over weight, I'm 
over the average height of an 11 year old. How is the last one going to

A lot. Um now selfconsous and I've been called like Ned a little bitch even 
though I'm 5"7 at 11 years old. 

I was depressed and got beaten up every day and since then I am too afraid 
to wear swimming trunks because of my self esteem issue. Some times I think

comments.text:
I'm 100% German, and I went to a new school. Someone asked me where I was 
from, I said the U.S.A, and then they said. I mean where is your family 
from. I told him i'm from Germany, then he called me a Nazi. Ever since 
that day it stuck with me, and my school life was miserable until I went to 
a new school. It happened 5 years ago and it still hurt's me to this day, I 
will never forget what he said to me.﻿
comments.author: Christian Ware

comments.text:
you would believe that violence is not the answer against bullying, the 
common thing is that you rely on parents or teachers but I'm pretty sure 
that if you were bullied you actually try to talk to your parents or your 
teachers and what would they do they would only call his(shes) parents or 
suspend them for what? 2 days! which would only make it worse.... my point 
is that in some cases bullying can be fight with violence because there is 
really no other way I DID i got tired of him because after asking him 
nicely and after trying to find a solution a peaceful solution so that he 
would stop bullying my friends I BEAT THE LIVING SHIT OUT OF HIM  and you 
know what it worked not any other kid in my classroom was bullied again as 
for him he apologized in front of everybody in class room and I'm pretty 
sure that since then he has lived a pretty normal life.﻿

comments.text: I love those eyes!﻿

comments.text:
i think being bullied is a gift in disguise. you understand yourself more,

comments.text:
I dont get anyone who bullies asians by calling them "small eyes" or chinky

comments.author: feel good

comments.text:
My teacher called me a stupid boy when I was in fifth grade. My "friend" 
lied and accused me of hurting a girl when he was the one who did it. Some 
of the students saw what happened but they kept silent, and no one dared to 
defend me or stand up for me. I cried in class when the teachers accused me 
too. Fake friends wasn't enough, the teachers didn't believe me either. 

      I also bullied a guy in my class. His name was Jacky and we all 
bullied him and even a fight occurred between me and him. I was trying to 
fit in, trying to be cool so my friends will accept me. Which not until the 
accusation from my "friend" that I learned about TRUST. 

     I saw Jacky last year while playing badminton. He was playing with his 
father and I was ashamed to confront him. Ashamed of what I did, scared 
that he will notice me. I wish I have the courage to say "sorry" to him 
that day but I just couldn't. I wasn't matured enough. Guess I might not 
get the chance to say "sorry" to him anymore.

     I think that was the time where I become super selective about my 
friends, not wanting to open up. I defend the weak, speak up for the unfair 
and just trying to help these people from everyone else. I am super 
sensitive and would often cry silently to events that begged for my 
empathy.﻿
comments.author: Johns

comments.text: YOUR ALL HOT, SEXY AND FABULOUS. I LOVE U BUZZ FEED GUYS!!!!﻿

comments.text:
i dont know but my area must be weird af then because. let me break it down
i go to a IB middle school basically kids from everywhere, whites, 
Bolivians, Ethiopians, blacks, asian and Bangladesh or indians. Kids always 
making immigration jokes to the Mexican/Bolivian kids like "whats a 
Mexicans favorite sport, cross country". Its really funny sometimes true 
but always offensive. Its very common and kids comprehend their race and 
stereotypes and joke on themselves. I love our school and the kids but what 
im saying is that sometimes you have to be strong and not so weak but i 
understand those who get bullied and offended. Bullying is wrong
I thought it would be interesting to see what others thought

Oh yea i forgot to say, my race is Hispanic(Paraguayan) but im a white kid 
& was born here in the U.S.A﻿

I've always been picked on... It's been bad like so bad that at I wanted to 
get plastic surgery because I was always embarrassed. There was a kid that 
would always say what's up c cup and just put me down! Even now it still 
makes me sad. But these guys and song writers and signers helped! One thing 
I always think now is; what doesn't kill you makes you stronger and it 
makes me happy! Now I have people that look at me and don't judge me! So to 
those people thank you and to those bullies out there that might read this 
get a life!!﻿

me or to hate me because of what they say because I liked me too much.﻿

comments.text: Kickin bully ass since 1st grade﻿
comments.author: Jacob Redda

comments.text:
I was always smaller and skinnier than all the other kids. I had a very bad 
speech impediment and a really high voice. My siblings and their friends 
used to bully me for my voice, and before long, I started school and the 
bullies multiplied. I was always called gay, elf-ears, dumb, stupid, 
faggot, etc... from before I started elementary school through middle 
school. I guess the only way to combat bullying is to find yourself. If you 
struggle with bullies, just be yourself and find a group of friends who 
won't let you down. Slowly, those words of "hurt" won't get to you anymore. 
Life will always go on, and don't let anyone else's words or actions hurt 
you.﻿
comments.author: stonerkid10

comments.text:
In jr high I also had bullies when I came out as bisexual. Kids would bully 
me, avoid me, and then when I came out as transgender they picked on me so 
much worse. One day this kid decides to shove me into a locker and threaten 
to rape me because I needed to be shown what kind of woman I was. I won't 
go into full detail but I will say that he is now infertil... and after 
that no one bullied me again. :D (violence is not the answer!)﻿
comments.author: Aairo Heart

comments.text:
I had bullies for being tall in my class. I was 5'9" in 5th grade and now 
I'm 22yrs and 5'11". A kid would always try to beat me up, he'd throw rocks 
and stuff at my head. One day after he decided to throw countless 
Basketballs at my head he had the balls to ask me, "hows the weather up 
there?" I told him, "good, but I hear it's raining down there," then I spit 
on him... I think I got the idea from a joke my dad told me but needless to 
say I was no longer bullied... to my face.﻿
comments.author: Aairo Heart

comments.text:
I got called a lot of stuff, from ugly, Banjo Buddy, gorilla on a daily in 
high school. It really affected me to the core, to the point where it was 
hard to approach girls I liked. It was tough, but I chose not to let it get 
me down. Looking back, I had poor self image in high school, but it made me 
stronger and more of an independent 'non-conformist'. I'd say I'm pretty 
fashionable now (not intentionally) and like unique stuff 'cuz I like it. 

Those who are teased stand out, and if you stand out, that's great. Those 
who get noticed for authenticity are better off then those who blend in.﻿
comments.author: Alex B.

comments.author: A Fallen Knight

comments.text:
You have to stand up to it. I was being bullied the first time in my life 
about a month ago and I was in tears everyday but one day I just called my 
mom to pick me up early from school and we talked to the counselor, I then 
talked to the kid and he said he'd stop. You at least have to try to stand 
up. If the person says no just report them, it doesn't matter if you get 
called a snitch or anything because you know you did the right thing and 
you most likely won't get picked on again. There's a difference between a 
snitch, a tattle tell, and someone speaking up. :)

comments.text:
I was bullied from grade 7-9, the school did nothing about the bully mainly 
because he was a star soccer player and got them recognized. This kid would 
call me things like "poor", "ugly", "mentally challenged" and "gay". I just 
stood there and tried to not show any emotion so maybe they'd get the idea 
that I wasn't taking offence. Long story short I see this little wanna-be 
thug walking into his low-rental ghetto house while I drive by. This 
brought back flashbacks, so I decided to post an ad on craigslist saying 
that I was shooting a porno there and that "EVERYBODY IS WELCOME" and other 
things on top of that. I ordered pizza, hookers and Chinese food to his 
house. I hope his mother was happy.﻿

comments.author: linkdude55

comments.text:
I was bullied from age 5 to 14 with very little break from it.
Seeing as it was both teachers and kids and given the nature of it all I 
was a weird quiet little kid, both unathletic and poor in lessons (I'm 
dyslexic) so an easy target, I also hate physically hurting anyone so that 
made things a lot easier for them.
All the troubles of my childhood meant I built worlds in my head, went on 
adventures, became interested in the world and in history, learned to draw 
and paint, learned to write.
So now I'm a weird quiet adult, in my 30s succesfully employed as an 
artist, I spend my days still building worlds, but now the adventures I 
have are not just in my head I go to the places I once read about or 
imagined going to thanks to my job.
I have nothing to say to my bullies, whats the point in wasting the breath 
to yell at a storm that has blown out and is now no more than a pale grey 
line on the horizon.﻿
comments.author: pixiniarts

comments.text:
I'm only in middle school but I have been bullied and it's horrible tbh. i 
have social anxiety, and at school there are these boys that like to take 
advantage of this by putting me in awkward and uncomfortable situations for 
their enjoyment,,, a lot of boys have done the thing where they ask me out 
as a joke?? i'm never able to say yes to anything like that anymore because 
i assume its a joke because obv i'm too ugly for anyone to like me i guess. 
i've been teased for being smart which is really fuckin ridiculous i mean?? 
being smart isn't "freaky" or "abnormal" right? ,,,, and most of the people 
at my school are homophobic even tho i know they're not directing their 
gross comments at me specifically it still makes me feel even worse about 
myself because i'm not straight. i'm really weird too imo, i'm made fun of 
for liking Japanese stuff and wanting to learn the language (everyone else 
at my school likes pretty much strictly english stuff which is kinda) . idk 
theres not much of a point to this comment, but i really needed to get this 
off my chest since i have no friends i can tell this to! i know other 
people have it worse and i should just be greatful for what i have but eeh. 
if u read thru this whole comment then thank you so much wow﻿
